page.title: 04Camperdown Wildlife Centre
page.content: Within a large public park stands {Camperdown Wildlife Centre,}whose purpose is primarily educational. It houses most of the indigenous animals of Scotland. There are 435 animals here, representing 20 mammal species, 36 bird species and one kind of reptile. The mammals include Red and Fallow deer, Red squirrels, Pine Martins, Pole Cats, Weasels, and a Brown Bear. Although it was opened in 1968 by the Parks and Recreation Department, the actual Centre was only built in 1973. The running costs of the Centre amount to some Â£65,000 per year. On our visit there, Mr Valentine, the Ranger, showed us round and told us about the different animals. Everyone at the Centre is keen to involve young people in learning about their native wildlife.
